title: What is a dhokla? And how do I make one? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dhokla (Gujarati: ઢોકળા ḍhōkḷā) is a vegetarian food item that originates from the Indian state of Gujarat. It is made with a fermented batter derived from rice and split chickpeas. Dhokla can be eaten for breakfast, as a main course, as a side dish, or as a snack. Here is my way to make instant khaman dhokla at home. There are various ways how you can do this at home. The real traditional dhokla required overnight fermenting and a lot of other ingredients. I am showing you the most popular one that people usually make at home across the country (khaman)- instant version. Most of Indian cooking is about slow cooking. So, be patient. Dhokla is a gujarati snack,soft & fluffy.It is actually a steamed cake made of gram flour.There are many things in it.It tastes tangy.I use the instant mix to prepare it.One can buy the gits dhokla mix & use it as per instructions.When the mix is steamed.place it in a flat plate then to give a final touch sizzle it with mustard seed,curry leaves,one teaspoon sugar…& delicious dhokla are ready.
